channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NJ

item.title: Report X-2023090507
item.description:
Report X-2023090507

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-04T18:16:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-05
  • City: DOVER
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package found in dump chute in warehouse, very wet/leaking & torn open. Line manager removed package from dump chute and placed into a red hazmat bin lined with a plastic hazmat bag. Manager brought package to back QA cage for inspection. DescribePack: Package was very wet/leaking. Box was torn open in places, but closures had also come open without tearing. Outer package does not appear punctured. Appears that the liquid leaking from inner bottles as well as the combined weight of these bottles within the package caused package to tear open. Package is an undeclared hazmat. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: When discovered, package was immediately placed into a lined hazmat bin. Leak in dump chute was cleaned with disposable absorbent cloth towels. Gloves worn while cleaning.

item.title: Report X-2023090427

Report X-2023090427

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-08
  • City: WAYNE
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE NOT DECLARED OR PROPERLY MARKED WITH DOT LABEL TO INFORM PACKAGE HANDLERS TO TREAT CAREFULLY. OPERATIONS MANAGER ON VAN LINE INFORMED QA OF WET LEAKING PACKAGE WITH ODOR. METAL DRUM INSIDE FIBERBOARD OVERPACK BOX SEVERELY DENTED AND LEAKING FROM BOTTOM LIP. PLACED INSIDE PLASTIC BAG AND HAZMAT TOTE AWAY FROM PEOPLE. DescribePack: BOTTOM LIP / CANNISTER WALL DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: PLACED AWAY FROM PEOPLE INSIDE PLASTIC HAZMAT TOTE BROUGHT TO VENTILATED HAZMAT AREA AT REAR OF BUILDING AFTER DISCOVERY

item.title: Report X-2023090433
item.description:
Report X-2023090433

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-02
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE OVERNIGHT SORT THE PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE HAZMAT CAGE SHOWING OBVIOUS SIGNS OF LEAKAGE. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION THE BOX CONTAINING RAPICIDE A AND B WAS FOUND WITH ONE OF THE BOTTLES SLIGHTY LEAKED OUT AND ONE RAPICIDE A BOTTLE MISSING. THEY WERE HURRIEDLY PLACED IN A SALVAGE DRUM TO BE RETURNED TO THE SHIPPER UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: FAILURE OF THE PACKAGE WAS DUE TO THE CAP BEING LOOSE CAUSING 1 HYDROGEN PEROXIDE AND PEROXYACETIC ACID MIXTURES TO BE LEAKED OUT ALSO ONE OF THE SAID ITEM TO BE MISSING. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: THE REMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALAVAGE DRUM TO AWAIT DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report X-2023090397

Report X-2023090397

  • City: KEASBEY

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package arrived at hazmat cage in a plastic bin during the sunrise sort. DescribePack: Inspection of "VWR 70% ISOPROPYL ALCOHOL" showed a dent on the top edge of the jerrycan, most likely caused from being dropped. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: Remaining contents will be returned to shipper in a plastic salvage drum, unless otherwise stated.

item.title: Report X-2023090389
item.description:
Report X-2023090389

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-01
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE OVERNIGHT SORT THE PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE HAZMAT CAGE SHOWING OBVIOUS SIGNS OF INTERNAL LEAKAGE. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION THE BOX CONTAINING HYDROCHLORIC ACID WAS FOUND WITH TWO OF THE BOTTLES DAMAGED. ONE FULLY LEAKED OUT THE OTHER SLIGHTY LEAKING. THEY WERE HURRIEDLY PLACED IN A SALVAGE DRUM TO BE RETURNED TO THE SHIPPER UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: FAILURE OF THE PACKAGE WAS DUE TO THE CAP BEING LOOSE AND ALSO CRACKED CAUSING 2 BOTTLES OF HYDROCHLORIC ACID TO BE DAMAGED. ( LEAKING). DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: THE REMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALAVAGE DRUM TO AWAIT DISPOSITION.

  • Description: UNLOADER WAS UNLOADING THE SHUTTLE, WHEN HE NOTICED THE LEAKING PACKAGE, HE NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR, WHO THEN NOTIFIED RESPONDER. RESPONDER WENT AND SECURED THE PACKAGE AND BROUGHT IT BACK TO THE DMP AND THE PROCESSED THRU THE DMP.

item.title: Report E-2023090680
item.description:
Report E-2023090680

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-30
  • City: ELIZABETH
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ACV ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: One of the 55-gal fiber drums, containing 2-3 inner container sacks of liquid, was crimped from air moisture due to being left out in the weather at the shipper's site. Employee retrieved an overpack in order to safely move it from the back of the box truck to the loading dock. During the overpack process, the lid of the fiber drum tore off the drum, releasing the contents of one of the inner sacks of liquid. Duration of the release was 10-15 seconds. Absorbent was used to contain the spill inside the cargo box of the truck as well as any material that was seeping through the floor. Absorbent was collected and disposed of properly.

item.title: Report X-2023090295
item.description:
Report X-2023090295

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-28T15:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-30
  • City: TRENTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Shipping box torn while in transit causing one of two Carlovers Bolt 2.5Gal jugs cap to become loose. Package was immediately placed in RED Tote upon discovery and brought to HAZMAT Cage for further processing. DescribePack: Shipping box torn while in transit causing one of two Carlovers Bolt 2.5Gal jugs cap to become loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately placed in RED Tote upon discovery and brought to HAZMAT Cage for further processing.

item.title: Report X-2023090286
item.description:
Report X-2023090286

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-28T15:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-29
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: IT APPEARS THE SHIPMENT WAS REMOVED FROM THE SYSTEM FLOW, DUE TO THE EXTERNAL CARTON BEING TORN AND WET DURING THE DAY SORT. DescribePack: UPON INSPECTION OF INNER CONTENTS RAPICIDE PA PART, A 2 BOTTLES AND PART B 2 BOTTLES 4X5 LITERS Hydrogen peroxide and peroxyacetic acid mixtures, stabilized WITH ONE PLASTIC BOTTLE OF PART B WITH A LOOSE CAP AND CAUSED LEAKAGING ALLOWING 10% SPILLAGE. DurationRel: 8 and MitigateEffect: FACILITY PROCEDURES FOR DAMAGED HAZARDOUS MATERIAL FOLLOWED, CONTENTS CONTAINED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION PGH.
